授業目的: The objective of this course is for the students to understand how research is conducted in business organizations. This course benefits the students in two ways: (1) it helps the students to conduct their Independent Research Project, and (2) it also enables the students to conduct research in real life business setting to solve related managerial problems.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of the requirements for this course, students will be able to:
a) understand and critically evaluate relevant academic and research literature;
b) develop data acquisition and management skills for research;
c) Evaluate the alternative research methods (qualitative, quantitative or mixed method) for their research;
d) develop, structure and present a research proposal; and
e) carry out a basic research project independently.
授業方法:
The course will be offered using "Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way". Classes will be held at the time specified in the timetable via interactive live streaming using Zoom.
Study materials (i.e., power point slides, exercises, and home assignment) will be uploaded in LUNA one week in advance. Students are strongly encouraged to read the materials before joining the class. It would be helpful to note down the key concepts in each chapter to discuss in the class.
Teaching methods include class lecture, students’ debate in class discussion, assignment, and final report.
Class lecture: In each class, instructor will open the discussion on a particular topic by clarifying the key concepts and theories. All students are expected to be prepared for class and actively participate and contribute in class room discussion.
Review of academic paper: Each student is required to choose a published paper based on his/her interest from any academic journal and write a formal review of the article. The review should start with asking the questions like: Why is the article important? What is the research question? and What is the authors’ motivation to write the paper? Subsequently students should also comment on other issues of the paper including research design, theoretical framework, hypothesis development, key findings, and contribution to literature and practice. You need to choose the paper within first two weeks of the semester. A standard review should be of 3 pages in A4 size paper.
Final report: Final report consists of submission of a formal research proposal.
